item.title: [DERBY-3820] Tasks for managing the 10.4.2 release
item.description: This JIRA tracks release management activities for 10.4.2.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Bumped release id to 10.4.2.0 via subversion revision 682719.

Attaching derby-3820-01-aa-fixReleaseNotesGenerator.diff. This updates the tool to accomodate changes which have been made to the format of JIRA reports. In particular, the xml reports no longer conform to an xml dialect specific to JIRA, Instead, xml JIRA reports are just generic xhtml documents now. Touches the following file:

M java/build/org/apache/derbyBuild/ReleaseNotesGenerator.java

Committed at subversion revision 683346.
Ported the changes to the release notes generator, 683346, from the trunk to the 10.4 branch at subversion revision 683362.

Attaching derby-3820-02-aa-releaseSummary.diff. This updates the release summary to describe the 10.4.2.0 release and regenerates the release notes accordingly. Touches the following files:

M releaseSummary.xml
M RELEASE-NOTES.html

Committed at subversion revision 683382.
Attaching derby-3820-03-aa-exceptionReference.diff. This updates the 10.4 Reference Guide with the latest generated version of the exception/sqlstate tables. Committed at subversion revision 687047.

Attaching derby-3820-04-aa-reviewableReleaseNotes.diff and the generated RELEASE_NOTES.html. This patch updates RELEASE_NOTES.html with the latest list of bug fixes which will be included in 10.4.2. Committed at subversion revision 687060.
The release note for DERBY-3701 talks about "version 10.5 and higher" and "starting with version 10.5" a couple of places. It should probably say 10.4.2 instead of 10.5 now.

Thanks for reviewing the release notes, Knut! The release note for 3701 may be correctly worded because Kathey says that when she ported the fix to 10.4 and 10.3, she reworked the patch to remove directory creation. However, let's confirm with Kathey.

Thanks for the explanation, Rick! If I understand correctly, the back-ported fix for DERBY-3701 removes the hang, but it still ignores the property if the directory doesn't exist, and the directory is not created. If that's the case, there is no incompatibility and the release note could be removed, I think.

Attaching derby-3820-05-aa-fixReleaseNotesGenerator.diff. This fixes a bug which caused the release notes generator to pick up attachments which weren't release notes. Touches the following file:

M java/build/org/apache/derbyBuild/ReleaseNotesGenerator.java

Committed to trunk at subversion revision 688742 and ported to 10.4 branch at subversion revision 688744.

Attaching derby-3820-06-aa-reviewableReleaseNotes.diff. This is rev 2 of the release notes for 10.4.2. This rev includes the release note for DERBY-48. Also attaching the generated release notes for review: RELEASE_NOTES.html

Committed at subversion revision 688749.

Myrna has commented on DERBY-3701, addressing concerns about the release note. I've airbrushed the release note a bit to clarify the distinction between branches and releases. I'm inclined to include this note in the issues section of the 10.4.2 release notes: the incompatibility is slight but worth documenting.

Was the uploading of jakarta-oro-2.0.8.jar intentional? It's not included in the directories for the older versions.
